entry.title: How to Download Adaptation Project Deployed to S/4HANA On-Premise System
entry.content:
For UI5 Apps and legacy UI5 Extension Projects, the project source is deployed to the UI5 ABAP Repository as a BSP Application, and program /UI5/UI5_REPOSITORY_LOAD can be used to download the source files in a ZIP file (at least those that were included in the deployment).

Adaptation Projects are deployed to the Layered Repository, not the UI5 ABAP Repository, and so the same program cannot be used. Is there an alternative program which can download the adaptation project source from the Layered Repository in a similar way? Is there a way to extract an adaptation project from an S/4HANA On-Premise system using Fiori Tools in BAS or VS Code?

entry.title: How to get all input fields from a fragment without using their IDs
entry.content:
Dear experts,

I know that getValue()works with specific control IDs, but I would like to retrieve all the input fields from a fragment without accessing each one by its ID.

Is there a recommended way to achieve this in SAPUI5?

Kind regards,
Lein

entry.title: SmartTable not displaying value text (Text Association) in SAPUI5 app embedded in MyInbox
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

 

I‚Äôm fairly new to SAPUI5 development, so please excuse me if my explanation isn‚Äôt perfectly professional yet üôÇ

I‚Äôm currently working on a freestyle SAPUI5 app that is embedded into MyInbox. In MyInbox, users can handle various tasks ‚Äî including invoice processing tasks.

My app is displayed for those invoice tasks and shows detailed invoice data.

 

What I‚Äôm trying to do

The app first shows invoice header data, and below that, it displays different SmartTables for navigation entities such as GLAccountItems, PurchaseOrderItems, etc.

One example SmartTable looks like this:

This works fine ‚Äî except for one detail:

When I show a field like CostCenter in a SmartField, I get something like this: 1234 (Development General)

But in the SmartTable, I only see: 1234

So the text description (value text) is missing in the table.

 

I‚Äôve learned that this topic is related to Text Associations in SAPUI5 / OData.

 

 

What I found in the metadata

The metadata for the CostCenter field contains a ValueList annotation, which defines its F4 help and seems to refer to a value list entity (VL_SH_FAC_COST_CENTERüòû

Picture 1

The referenced value list entity looks like this (simplified for readability):

Picture 2

From what I understand, sap:text="KTEXT" defines the link between the key (KOSTL) and its text. So I assume this is where the ‚ÄúDevelopment General‚Äù text comes from when using a SmartField.

 

 

Additional metadata section (possibly related)

There‚Äôs also another annotation on the same property that I don‚Äôt fully understand:

Picture 3

Does this Common.v1.Text annotation link the CostCenter key to its text value internally? And if yes ‚Äî why does it work in a SmartField but not inside a SmartTable column?

 

 

What I‚Äôve heard

Apparently, it might be possible to override or extend metadata annotations using a custom annotation file (for example, adding or redefining the com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.Text term).

Would this be a valid approach to make the SmartTable also display the text value (e.g., 1234 (Development General)) instead of only the key?

 

 

My question

How can I make my SmartTable display both the key and the text (using the Text Association) for fields like CostCenter ‚Äî just like SmartField does?

If a custom annotation file is the right way, how exactly should it look like?

If you need additional metadata snippets, project settings, or controller code to help analyze this, I‚Äôm happy to share more details.

 

Thanks so much in advance for any help or best practices you can provide!

entry.title: Questions Regarding SAP IBP Fiori Planning View
entry.content:
Hello,

I have two questions regarding the SAP IBP Fiori Planning View:

  2. Displaying Subtotals

Thank you for your assistance.

Best regards,

entry.title: Wrong tax calculation in MIRO
entry.content:
Hello,

I‚Äôve noticed a 0.01 EUR difference in tax calculation during MIRO posting.

Example:
Net amount = 164.35 EUR
Tax rate = 23%
Expected tax = 37.80 EUR
SAP calculated tax = 37.81 EUR

All item prices are entered with 2 decimals (12.52, 11.55, 8.80, each with 5 units), so this doesn‚Äôt seem to be caused by item-level rounding.

Any guidance on where to check or adjust would be appreciated.

Thank you!

entry.title: Fiori Elements list report controller extension typescript : editFlow().getView() does not work
entry.content:
I have created an fiori elements list report app and added a List Report controller extension using 'Page Map' feature of SAP Fiori Tools. I am using typescript and want to get the view instance of the current list report page. Here is my controller extension .ts code:

import ControllerExtension from 'sap/ui/core/mvc/ControllerExtension';
import ExtensionAPI from 'sap/fe/templates/ListReport/ExtensionAPI';
import Context from 'sap/ui/model/odata/v4/Context';
import EditFlow from 'sap/fe/core/controllerextensions/EditFlow';
import View from 'sap/ui/core/mvc/View';


/**
 * @namespace my.project.ext.controller
 * @controller
 */
export default class ListReportExt extends ControllerExtension<ExtensionAPI> {
	oView: View
	
	static overrides = {
		/**
		 * Called when a controller is instantiated and its View controls (if available) are already created.
		 * Can be used to modify the View before it is displayed, to bind event handlers and do other one-time initialization.
		 * @memberOf com.udhg.zprojectinfo.ext.controller.ListReportExt
		 */
		onInit(this: ListReportExt) {
			// you can access the Fiori elements extensionAPI via this.base.getExtensionAPI
			const model = this.base.getExtensionAPI().getModel();
			const extensionAPI = this.base.getExtensionAPI();
			this.oView = (this.base.getExtensionAPI().getEditFlow() as EditFlow).getView();
		},
		onAfterRendering(this: ListReportExt) {

		},
		routing: {
			onAfterBinding(this: ListReportExt)   {
				const EditFlow = this.base.getExtensionAPI().getEditFlow() 
			}
		}
	};
	
}

The getView() method on EditFlow instance is not recognized:

 

How can I make this work?

@Marian_Zeis @MioYasutake @AndreasKunz

entry.title: SAPUI5 App Changes Not Reflected After Transport to QAS Until User Cache Is Cleared
entry.content:
Hello experts, good day.

Has anyone experienced a similar situation to the one I‚Äôll describe below?

Here‚Äôs a brief overview of the scenario:

We developed a custom SAPUI5 application in the Development (DEV) environment. Everything worked correctly during the initial development and testing phases.

Afterward, we created a Workbench Transport Request to move the app from DEV to QAS for further testing.

The transport completed successfully ‚Äî no dumps or errors were raised. However, when reviewing the application in QAS, the latest changes are not visible.

Initially, we suspected a browser cache issue, so we cleared browser data and even tested in incognito mode, but the issue persisted ‚Äî the old version of the app was still shown.

After further analysis, we found that if we clear the SAP user cache, the latest changes appear correctly.

Has anyone else encountered a similar situation ‚Äî where clearing the user-specific cache is required for updated SAPUI5 content to appear?

This behavior could become problematic in the long run since multiple users will be accessing the app, and asking each one to clear their cache is not practical.

Any insights or recommendations on:

  • What might be causing this behavior?

  • Best practices or configuration tips to prevent it?

Thanks in advance for your time and support.

Best regards,
EBZ

entry.title: Flexible Programming Model sortOrder ignored by macros Table
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I have a FPM project with first view containing macros Filterbar und Table.

The table displays the data, but ignores the CDS Annotation SortOrder from the PresentationVarian:

.presentationVariant: [{
qualifier: 'DefaultSorter',
sortOrder: [{ by: 'ManufacturingOrder', direction: #DESC }],
visualizations: [{type: #AS_LINEITEM }]
}]

I even added the property to the manifest file:

"defaultTemplateAnnotationPath": "com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.PresentationVariant#DefaultSorter",

I can see in the oData metadata the annotation is present.

I am currently using the 1.120.0 version, but the same result is with 1.141.3

Is there any additional property expected by the macros table? In the API Dokumentation it is written :
Usually, a LineItem, PresentationVariant, or SelectionPresentationVariant annotation is expected, but the Table building block can also be used to display an EntitySet.
If a PresentationVariant is specified, then it must have UI.LineItem as the first property of the Visualizations.

 

Thanks for you help!

@Navin_Krishnan

entry.title: Unable to hide a custom field on the Pay component recurring HRIS element
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

We have a custom-double field called FTE calculated amount on the pay component recurring HRIS element and few of the countries have requested this field to be hidden. I have tried business rules with all possible scenarios (cross entity, onView, onInit etc) with different base objects Job information, compensation and pay component recurring however none of this is triggering the rule. Only the Always True in IF condition is hiding the field but this is not serving our purpose. 

Is this some kind of bug/known issue or anything that I am missing in the business rule?

Please advice. 

Thanks you ! 

Regards

Archana

entry.title: Smart Table with annotation.xml
entry.content:
Hello,

I created a freestyle application configured with an OData V2 service. After generating the project, I added an annotations.xml file to define the columns for my entity type. Then, I added a SmartTable controller bound to my entity.

However, the columns are not being displayed in the SmartTable.
Could you please help me understand what might be missing or incorrectly configured?

Thank you.

Main.view.xml

<mvc:View
    controllerName="dummy3.controller.Main"
    xmlns:mvc="sap.ui.core.mvc"
    xmlns="sap.m"
    xmlns:smartTable="sap.ui.comp.smarttable"
>
    <Page
        id="page"
        title="{i18n>title}"
    >
        <smartTable:SmartTable
            id="idSalesOrderSmartTable"
            entitySet="ZC_SALESORDER_HEADER"
            header="Sales Order"
            enableAutoBinding="true"
        />
    </Page>
</mvc:View>

Main.controller.ts

import SmartTable from "sap/ui/comp/smarttable/SmartTable";
import Controller from "sap/ui/core/mvc/Controller";
import ODataModel from "sap/ui/model/odata/v2/ODataModel";

/**
 * @namespace dummy3.controller
 */
export default class Main extends Controller {

    /*eslint-disable @typescript-eslint/no-empty-function*/
    public onInit(): void {

        const serviceUri = this.getOwnerComponent()!.getManifestEntry("/sap.app/dataSources").mainService.uri;
        console.log("serviceUri: " + serviceUri);
        const model = new ODataModel(serviceUri);

        this.getView()!.setModel(model);
    }
}

annotation0.xml

<edmx:Edmx xmlns:edmx="http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/ns/edmx" Version="4.0">
    <edmx:Reference Uri="/sap/opu/odata/IWFND/CATALOGSERVICE;v=2/Vocabularies(TechnicalName='%2FIWBEP%2FVOC_COMMON',Version='0001',SAP__Origin='LOCAL')/$value">
        <edmx:Include Namespace="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1" Alias="Common"/>
    </edmx:Reference>
    <edmx:Reference Uri="/sap/opu/odata/IWFND/CATALOGSERVICE;v=2/Vocabularies(TechnicalName='%2FIWBEP%2FVOC_UI',Version='0001',SAP__Origin='LOCAL')/$value">
        <edmx:Include Namespace="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1" Alias="UI"/>
    </edmx:Reference>
    <edmx:Reference Uri="/sap/opu/odata/IWFND/CATALOGSERVICE;v=2/Vocabularies(TechnicalName='%2FIWBEP%2FVOC_COMMUNICATION',Version='0001',SAP__Origin='LOCAL')/$value">
        <edmx:Include Namespace="com.sap.vocabularies.Communication.v1" Alias="Communication"/>
    </edmx:Reference>
    <edmx:Reference Uri="/sap/opu/odata/sap/ZUI_CUSTOMERS_SRV_V2/$metadata">
        <edmx:Include Namespace="cds_zc_customers_srv" Alias="SAP"/>
    </edmx:Reference>
    <edmx:DataServices>
        <Schema xmlns="http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/ns/edm" Namespace="local1">

            <Annotations Target="cds_zc_customers_srv.ZC_SALESORDER_HEADERType">
                <Annotation Term="UI.LineItem">
                    <Collection>
                        <Record Type="UI.DataField">
                            <PropertyValue Property="Value" Path="OrderNumber"  />
                        </Record>
                    </Collection>
                </Annotation>
                
            </Annotations>
        </Schema>
    </edmx:DataServices>
</edmx:Edmx>

manifest.json

{
    "_version": "1.76.0",
    "sap.app": {
        "id": "dummy3",
        "type": "application",
        "i18n": "i18n/i18n.properties",

                "type": "ODataAnnotation",

                    "localUri": "localService/mainService/ZUI_CUSTOMERS_SRV_V2_VAN.xml"

            "mainService": {

}

entry.title: beforeOpenContextMenu is not firing when right-clicking on a group header in sap.ui.table.Analytical
entry.content:
Hi,

I am using an SAPUI5 Analytical Table where grouping is implemented at one level.
When I right-click on a group header, the context menu opens with options such as Ungroup Level and Ungroup All.
Since I am using only one grouping level, I would like to hide one of these options (for example, Ungroup Level).
To achieve this, I tried using the beforeOpenContextMenu event to modify the menu items dynamically. However, this event does not trigger when right-clicking on the group header.
On the other hand, the attachColumnSelect event is triggered correctly when right-clicking on a column header (for sorting and filtering), and I am able to hide unwanted menu items there.
I expect similar behavior when right-clicking on the group header to customize that context menu as well.

Steps to Reproduce:
Use an Analytical Table (sap.ui.table.AnalyticalTable) with one-level grouping enabled.
Right-click on a column header ‚Üí attachColumnSelect triggers correctly.
Right-click on a group header (e.g., ‚ÄúCompany Code = XXXX‚Äù) ‚Üí context menu appears with Ungroup Level and Ungroup All options.
Observe that the beforeOpenContextMenu event does not trigger.

Expected Behavior:
When the user right-clicks on a group header, the beforeOpenContextMenu event should trigger so that developers can modify or hide specific menu options (for example, remove Ungroup Level when only one grouping level is used).

Actual Behavior:
The context menu is displayed when right-clicking on a group header, but the beforeOpenContextMenu event is not fired.

Code Snippet Used:
const oTable = this.byId("dynamicTable");
// Works on column header right-click
oTable.attachColumnSelect((oEvent) => {
    console.log(oEvent);
});

// Not triggered on group header right-click
oTable.attachBeforeOpenContextMenu((oEvent) => {
    console.log("Context menu event triggered:", oEvent);
});

Please let me know if I am missing anything or if there is an alternative way to capture the context menu event on group headers to modify or remove menu options dynamically.

Regards,
Sridevi

entry.title: SAPUI5 application in Build Workzone with CAP Application as a proxy to the backend returns 403
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I have a scenario that seems to be quite common, but I'm failing to find why exactly the integration between the SAPUI5 and a CAP microsservice is not working. In what follows there are some details:

  • I have a CAP application with an approuter that will act as a intermediate between a simple customized table with data of things that relate to a specific customer. In the backend, there is a configuration that maps an user email with the customer that will be used. The backend itself is a OData service exposed through integration suite. This project was created with the CAP template in Business Application Studio. This part is working pretty much fine: i can access the instance of the CAP service with the approuter from a browser
  • I have a SAPUI5 application which has its own lifecycle, so it lives in a separate repository than the CAP microsservice. This application is hosted in SAP Build Workzone, standard edition, and the objective is to forward any request to the backend to the CAP Microssservice as a proxy to the backend that adds the user ID information (i.e., the email of the logged in user) seamlessly to retrieve data in the backend without the user even knowing that this is happening .

The CAP service works like a charm if I call the endpoint from the Browser:

And now, I want to be able to call this same endpoint from my SAPUi5 application that is hosted in SAP Build workzone. I have seen the documentation of Build Workzone  and went through some tutorials, but all of them shows the case when the UI is deployed altogether with the CAP service in the same repository, which unfortunately is not my case. 

I have went through a lot of blog posts and other questions that looked like a similar error was happening, but I had no luck in fixing so far.

 

Here's my understanding:

  • The CAP app has two service instances managed within its mta: gt-customer-portal-access-auth (technical name xsuaa, plan application) and gt-customer-portal-access-auth (technical name destination, plan lite). They are both binded to the approuter and to the CAP generated service, so it looks good
    below is the MTA of the CAP service:
    _schema-version: 3.3.0
    ID: gt-customer-portal-access
    version: 1.0.0
    description: "A simple CAP project."
    parameters:
      enable-parallel-deployments: true
    build-parameters:
      before-all:
        - builder: custom
          commands:
            - npm ci
            - npx cds build --production
    modules:
      - name: gt-customer-portal-access-srv
        type: nodejs
        path: gen/srv
        parameters:
          instances: 1
          buildpack: nodejs_buildpack
        build-parameters:
          builder: npm-ci
        provides:
          - name: srv-api # required by consumers of CAP services (e.g. approuter)
            properties:
              srv-url: ${default-url}
        requires:
          - name: gt-customer-portal-access-auth
          - name: gt-customer-portal-access-destination

      - name: gt-customer-portal-access
        type: approuter.nodejs
        path: app/router
        parameters:
          keep-existing-routes: true
          disk-quota: 256M
          memory: 256M
        requires:
          - name: srv-api
            group: destinations
            properties:
              name: srv-api # must be used in xs-app.json as well
              url: ~{srv-url}
              forwardAuthToken: true
          - name: gt-customer-portal-access-auth
          - name: gt-customer-portal-access-destination
        provides:
          - name: app-api
            properties:
              app-protocol: ${protocol}
              app-uri: ${default-uri}

    resources:
      - name: gt-customer-portal-access-auth
        type: org.cloudfoundry.managed-service
        parameters:
          service: xsuaa
          service-plan: application
          path: ./xs-security.json
          config:
            xsappname: gt-customer-portal-access-gt-br-${space}
            tenant-mode: dedicated
            oauth2-configuration:
              redirect-uris:
                - https://*~{app-api/app-uri}/**
        requires:
          - name: app-api
      - name: gt-customer-portal-access-destination
        type: org.cloudfoundry.managed-service
        parameters:
          service: destination
          service-plan: lite
    in xs-security.json, I have the following: 
    {
      "xsappname": "gt-customer-portal-access-gt-br-${space}",
      "tenant-mode": "dedicated",
      "oauth2-configuration" : {
        "grant-types" : [
          "authorization_code",
          "password",
          "client_credentials",
          "refresh_token",
          "user_token"
        ]
      },
      "scopes": [
        { "name": "$XSAPPNAME.User", "description": "Default user scope" }
      ],
      "role-templates": [
        {
          "name": "UserRole",
          "description": "Default user role",
          "scope-references": ["$XSAPPNAME.User"]
        }
      ]
    }
    and I have already assigned the UserRole to my User in BTP through a new Role Collection.

    in the approuter, I have the following:

    {
      "routes": [
        {
          "source": "^/(.*)$",
          "target": "$1",
          "destination": "srv-api",
          "csrfProtection": true
        }
      ]
    }
     
  • In my SAPUI5 application, as per some of the documents i've gone through, I should bind the same XSUAA instance that is managed by the CAP Application. So the MTA of the UI5 application is as below (there are some comments as I was trying different approaches to know where exactly the problem could be). Below is the MTA.yaml file of the SAPUI5 app:
    _schema-version: "3.2"
    ID: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin
    description: Generated by Fiori Tools
    version: 0.0.1
    modules:
    - name: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin-destination-content
    type: com.sap.application.content
    requires:
    - name: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin-destination-service
    parameters:
    content-target: true
    - name: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin-repo-host
    parameters:
    service-key:
    name: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin-repo-host-key
    - name: gt-customer-portal-access-auth
    parameters:
    service-key:
    name: key
    parameters:
    content:
    instance:
    destinations:
    - Name: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin_html_repo_host
    ServiceInstanceName: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin-html5-service
    ServiceKeyName: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin-repo-host-key
    sap.cloud.service: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin
    #09/11/2025 - abaixo acho que deve apontar pro camarada no CF.
    #- Name: gt-customer-portal-access-aut
    #ServiceInstanceName: gt-customer-portal-access-aut
    #ServiceKeyName: ke
    #Authentication: OAuth2UserTokenExchang
    #sap.cloud.service: comvendorcustomermaterialorigi
    # - Name: customer_Brasil_GT_CAP_BE
    # URL: https://fb031469trial-dev-gt-customer-portal-access.cfapps.us10-001.hana.ondemand.com
    # ServiceInstanceName:
    # ServiceKeyName:
    # Authentication: OAuth2UserTokenExchange
    # ProxyType: Internet
    # HTML5.DynamicDestination: true
    # sap.cloud.service: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin
    # forwardAuthToken: true
    # - Authentication: OAuth2UserTokenExchange
    # Name: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin_uaa
    # ServiceInstanceName: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin-xsuaa-service
    # ServiceKeyName: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin-uaa-key
    # sap.cloud.service: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin
    existing_destinations_policy: update
    build-parameters:
    no-source: true
    - name: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin-app-content
    type: com.sap.application.content
    path: .
    requires:
    - name: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin-repo-host
    parameters:
    content-target: true
    build-parameters:
    build-result: resources
    requires:
    - artifacts:
    - comvendorcustomermaterialorigin.zip
    name: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin
    target-path: resources/
    - name: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin
    type: html5
    path: .
    build-parameters:
    build-result: dist
    builder: custom
    commands:
    - npm install
    - npm run build:cf
    supported-platforms: []
    resources:
    - name: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin-destination-service
    type: org.cloudfoundry.managed-service
    parameters:
    config:
    HTML5Runtime_enabled: true
    init_data:
    instance:
    destinations:
    - Authentication: NoAuthentication
    Name: ui5
    ProxyType: Internet
    Type: HTTP
    URL: https://ui5.sap.com
    - Authentication: NoAuthentication #setar a destination aqui n√£o seria necess√°rio se vc fizer dirteto no BTP. Por√©m, aparentemente √© uma boa pr√°tica fazer isso a partir
    #do mta
    Name: portal-clientes-credentials
    ProxyType: Internet
    Type: HTTP
    URL: https://fb031469trial-dev-get-user-email-saml.cfapps.us10-001.hana.ondemand.com
    #update abaixo: ap√≥s voltar o app no Workzone com 403 - ultima tentativa hoje _ 02:24 08/11/2024
    # - Authentication: OAuth2UserTokenExchange
    # Name: customer_Brasil_GT_CAP_BE
    # URL: https://fb031469trial-dev-gt-customer-portal-access.cfapps.us10-001.hana.ondemand.com
    # Type: HTTP
    # ProxyType: Internet
    # forwardAuthToken: true
    # existing_destinations_policy: update
    version: 1.0.0
    service: destination
    service-name: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin-destination-service
    service-plan: lite
    - name: gt-customer-portal-access-auth
    type: org.cloudfoundry.existing-service
    # parameters:
    # path: ./xs-security.json
    # service: xsuaa
    # service-name: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin-xsuaa-service
    # service-plan: application
    - name: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin-repo-host
    type: org.cloudfoundry.managed-service
    parameters:
    service: html5-apps-repo
    service-name: comvendorcustomermaterialorigin-html5-service
    service-plan: app-host
    parameters:
    deploy_mode: html5-repo
    enable-parallel-deployments: true

  • Note that it refers to the same xsuaa service as in gt-customer-portal-access-auth.

The problem is that when I open the app in build Workzone, the medatada call for the service returns 403 forbidden without even reaching the app router (I Believe so as there is no logs in the service instance, so it's a bit odd)

Note that i have added a call to the service "whoami" as a test service that is in the CAP application and it's returning 404, and if i uncomment this part of the MTA and redeploy:

  • # - Authentication: OAuth2UserTokenExchange
    # Name: customer_Brasil_GT_CAP_BE
    # URL: https://fb031469trial-dev-gt-customer-portal-access.cfapps.us10-001.hana.ondemand.com
    # Type: HTTP
    # ProxyType: Internet
    # forwardAuthToken: true
    # existing_destinations_policy: update

it also returns 403 now:

I am not sure exactly what needs to be done either in CAP or in the SAPUI5 setup, as it looks like the CAP setup is OK, and most of the documents/blogs says that a destination in BTP level should be enough for the Build workzone approuter to connect to the CAP service. I have this destination setup as below:

Does anyone have gone a similar requirement and managed to make it work? I'm thinking that the approuter generated with my cap app can be the culprit but i'm not sure.

I also checked mostly the capire documents (which always uses the samples of UI5 along with CAP at the same deployment) and the documentation of Build Workzone (mainly https://help.sap.com/docs/build-work-zone-standard-edition/sap-build-work-zone-standard-edition/developing-html5-applications-and-extensions?locale=en-US and other related topics), but I still had no luck on making it work. There is also a sample in https://github.com/SAP-samples/cap-sflight but it uses an approuter from the SAPUI5, which I understood that is not the case when deployng the application to SAP Build Workzone, standard edition (looks like it has its own approuter).

Really appreciate any inputs,

Erick Grilo.

entry.title: How to get a list of standard Fiori applications that are extended in the system?
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

We have a requirement to identify if any standard SAP Fiori applications in our system have been extended or enhanced.

Is there any  way to get a list of standard Fiori apps that have been extended in S/4HANA?

We are looking for a reliable method to check which standard apps have been customized, either on the frontend or backend side.

Thanks in advance for your help!
